rules.natural: If the factory produces alcohol, then the company is profitable.
Provided that the manufacturer imports alcohol, the company is profitable.

Either the product passes inspection, or if it is not the case that the absence of the manufacturer importing alcohol implies the absence of the manufacturer exporting alcohol, then the company violates the regulation.
Whenever the process follows the protocol, then if the factory does not produce alcohol, the plant uses extraction.
If the factory implements the protocol, then the process follows the protocol.
Provided that quality control detects contamination, the food batch is not contaminated.
In the event that the researcher identifies the pathogen, the food batch is not contaminated.
The lab tests the sample or the scientist analyzes the data.
Whenever the scientist analyzes the data, the researcher identifies the pathogen.
If the agency issues a warning, then the health department alerts the public.
Either the agency issues a warning or the journal publishes the findings.
In the event that the journal publishes the findings, then if the government bans the export, the manufacturer does not export alcohol.
Provided that the game requires testing, then if the plant uses fermentation, the plant uses extraction.
Either the game requires testing or the game requires simulation.
If the game requires simulation, then whenever the plant uses fermentation, the plant uses extraction.
Either the disease has an approved treatment or the company is profitable.
If the lab develops a vaccine, then the food batch is contaminated.
Either the lab develops a vaccine or the disease does not have an approved treatment.
Provided that the company recalls the food, the food batch is not contaminated.
If it is not the case that testing the sample by the lab implies that quality control detects contamination, then the product fails the safety check.

If it is not the case that the health department alerting the public implies that if the government bans the export then the manufacturer does not export alcohol, then the regulator suspends the license.
Provided that it is not the case that the absence of the manufacturer importing alcohol implies the absence of the manufacturer exporting alcohol, the company does not violate the regulation.
In the event that the factory does not produce alcohol, the plant uses fermentation.
If the factory does not produce alcohol, then the plant does not use extraction.
Provided that the manufacturer does not import alcohol, the manufacturer exports alcohol.
If the manufacturer does not import alcohol, then the government bans the export.

facts.natural: The product does not pass inspection.
The product does not fail the safety check.
The regulator does not suspend the license.

(A1 → G).natural: If the factory produces alcohol, then the company is profitable.

(A10 → G).natural: Provided that the manufacturer imports alcohol, the company is profitable.

(A13 ∨ (¬(¬A10 → ¬A11) → A12)).natural: Either the product passes inspection, or if it is not the case that the absence of the manufacturer importing alcohol implies the absence of the manufacturer exporting alcohol, then the company violates the regulation.

(A14 → (¬A1 → A2)).natural: Whenever the process follows the protocol, then if the factory does not produce alcohol, the plant uses extraction.

(A15 → A14).natural: If the factory implements the protocol, then the process follows the protocol.

(A16 → ¬A8).natural: Provided that quality control detects contamination, the food batch is not contaminated.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: Either quality control detects contamination or the researcher identifies the pathogen.

(A17 → ¬A8).natural: In the event that the researcher identifies the pathogen, the food batch is not contaminated.

(A18 → A16).natural: If the lab tests the sample, then quality control detects contamination.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: The lab tests the sample or the scientist analyzes the data.

(A19 → A17).natural: Whenever the scientist analyzes the data, the researcher identifies the pathogen.

(A21 → ¬A11).natural: If the government bans the export, then the manufacturer does not export alcohol.

(A22 → (A21 → ¬A11)).natural: Provided that the agency issues a warning, then if the government bans the export, the manufacturer does not export alcohol.

(A22 → A24).natural: If the agency issues a warning, then the health department alerts the public.

(A22 ∨ A23).natural: Either the agency issues a warning or the journal publishes the findings.

(A23 → (A21 → ¬A11)).natural: In the event that the journal publishes the findings, then if the government bans the export, the manufacturer does not export alcohol.

(A24 → (A21 → ¬A11)).natural: If the health department alerts the public, then provided that the government bans the export, the manufacturer does not export alcohol.

(A3 → A2).natural: If the plant uses fermentation, then the plant uses extraction.

(A4 → (A3 → A2)).natural: Provided that the game requires testing, then if the plant uses fermentation, the plant uses extraction.

(A4 ∨ A5).natural: Either the game requires testing or the game requires simulation.

(A5 → (A3 → A2)).natural: If the game requires simulation, then whenever the plant uses fermentation, the plant uses extraction.

(A6 ∨ G).natural: Either the disease has an approved treatment or the company is profitable.

(A7 → A8).natural: If the lab develops a vaccine, then the food batch is contaminated.

(A7 ∨ ¬A6).natural: Either the lab develops a vaccine or the disease does not have an approved treatment.

(A9 → ¬A8).natural: Provided that the company recalls the food, the food batch is not contaminated.

(¬(A18 → A16) → A20).natural: If it is not the case that testing the sample by the lab implies that quality control detects contamination, then the product fails the safety check.

(¬(A24 → (A21 → ¬A11)) → A25).natural: If it is not the case that the health department alerting the public implies that if the government bans the export then the manufacturer does not export alcohol, then the regulator suspends the license.

(¬(¬A10 → ¬A11) → A12).natural: If it is not the case that the absence of the manufacturer importing alcohol implies the absence of the manufacturer exporting alcohol, then the company violates the regulation.

(¬(¬A10 → ¬A11) → ¬A12).natural: Provided that it is not the case that the absence of the manufacturer importing alcohol implies the absence of the manufacturer exporting alcohol, the company does not violate the regulation.

(¬A1 → A2).natural: If the factory does not produce alcohol, then the plant uses extraction.

(¬A1 → A3).natural: In the event that the factory does not produce alcohol, the plant uses fermentation.

(¬A1 → ¬A2).natural: If the factory does not produce alcohol, then the plant does not use extraction.

(¬A10 → A11).natural: Provided that the manufacturer does not import alcohol, the manufacturer exports alcohol.

(¬A10 → A21).natural: If the manufacturer does not import alcohol, then the government bans the export.

(¬A10 → ¬A11).natural: Whenever the manufacturer does not import alcohol, the manufacturer does not export alcohol.

¬A25.natural: The regulator does not suspend the license.
